Drugs--Lifespan lost?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Research on game mechanics: Drugs--Lifespan lost?
By Harrabcat on Wednesday, January 14, 2004 - 04:51 pm:

Yo, me again. This time dabbling a bit in drugs. I took those pixies (T6-T10, Refer to Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here) : Pixie Lifespan Tests for more information.) and I gave each of them 2 doses of drugs (So I could see the result) Each of them were given a different type of drug.

Drugs used: Troron,Nageel,Baisin,Tapaurin

I left out T7 because I thought that weight could possibly have an effect on drugs. Here my timeliney thing(somebody tell me what to call this) The save is starts on 8mo1wk. All variable for the lifespan tests were kept constant except the feeding of drugs. All of my pixies disliked the drugs

8mo2wk T6 fed Troron
T8 fed Nageel
T9 fed Baisin
T10 fed Tapaurin
8mo3wk T6 fed Troron
T8 fed Nageel
T9 fed Baisin
T10 fed Tapaurin
10mo1wkT6,T7,T8,T9,T10 all died

As you can( or cannot) see the monsters had no lifeloss. I don't know if this is because of them being fat, Not being fed enough drugs, because they are pixies, or whatever. As always more testing is needed. Another test, Another day.

Any questions, comments, or the likewise

By D knight on Thursday, January 15, 2004 - 09:21 am:

hmm well it makes sence that drugs wouldnt cause life loss in this one since they dont actually change stats like they did in previous games.

but awsome discovery!

By Jin on Friday, January 16, 2004 - 06:11 pm:

Did you happen to use drugs that work on adventures? If so, did you actually go on an adventure while it was in effect...?

By Harrabcat on Sunday, January 18, 2004 - 10:29 am:

Nageel adds energy to adventures and I did use it on T8. I didn't go on any adventures because thats another variable.

By Jin on Sunday, January 18, 2004 - 11:24 am:

Test it out, because otherwise I assume the drug isn't actually having an effect. Didn't you prove that adventures don't affect lifespan too? Do the same thing you did just do it while the drug is in effect.

By Harrabcat on Sunday, January 18, 2004 - 12:55 pm:

By Harrabcat on Wednesday, February 4, 2004 - 06:52 pm:

Ok Extended research a bit



xT1T2T3T4T5
8/1NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

9/3TroronNoneTroronTroronTroron
9/4Potato, TroronVitaminPotato, TroronPotato, TroronPork, Troron

There You go still no lifespan loss

Any questions, comments, or the likewise?

By Infernus on Thursday, February 5, 2004 - 02:38 pm:

By Harrabcat on Friday, February 6, 2004 - 07:24 pm:

Ok New experiment testing if drugs only effect
lifespan when used. I used Troron and when i battled i tried to lose. I fed drugs before the battle. All other variables are the same as in the pixie test. Only used T6 in this experiments



8/4-T6 Battled Using Troron
9/1-T6 Battled Using Troron and got KO'd
9/3-T6 Battled Using Troron, Got one hit KO'd, And got sent to hospital
9/4-T6 in hospital
10/1-T6 retired without coming home from the hospital



Ok, I might have to redo this experiment because I don't know if going to the hospital prevented T6 from retiring that week or what

Questions, comment, or the likewise?
By torey luvullo on Friday, February 6, 2004 - 07:27 pm:

By Petit-Trot on Friday, February 6, 2004 - 07:28 pm:

By Harrabcat on Saturday, February 7, 2004 - 11:00 am:

Ok I redid the test. T6 went one 3 tournaments each of them i tried to get him ko'd (but not injured) heres the result. I kept all variables from the lifespan test the same.



XT6T7
8/1NoneNone
8/2PotatoNone
8/3NoneNone
8/4Battled Using Drugs, PotatoVitamin
9/1Battled Using Drugs(KO'd)None
9/2PotatoNone
9/3Battled Using Drugs(KO'd Twice)None
9/4PotatoVitamin
10/1DiedDied




As You can (or cannot) see T6 still had no lifespan loss even after getting KO'd 3 times and using drugs during battles.

Questions, comments, or the likewise?
